it.polito.dp2.NFV

Interface NodeReader

  • All Superinterfaces:
    NamedEntityReader

    public interface NodeReader
extends NamedEntityReader
    An interface for accessing the data associated with a network node inside an NF-FG. A network node is a generic representation of an element in an NF-FG, like a network function (e.g., router, firewall, DPI and other), and client (e.g., web client) and server (e.g., web server). A node is characterized by a name, which uniquely identifies it within the DP2-NFV system, and a functional type to indicate the network functionality the node is able to perform. This interface gives also access to the set of outgoing links that connect this node (named source node) to a neighbor node (named destination node).

    • Method Detail

      • getFuncType

        VNFTypeReader getFuncType()
        Gives the functional type of the node. The available network nodes provide one of the functionalities that are present in the catalog (FunctionalType).
        Returns:
        the functional type of the node.

      • getLinks

        java.util.Set<LinkReader> getLinks()
        Gives the known links that connect this node (i.e. have this node as the source node) in the network topology.
        Returns:
        a set of interfaces for accessing the information of known links that connect this node with the other nodes of the network.

      • getHost

        HostReader getHost()
        Gives access to the Host this node is allocated on.
        Returns:
        an interface for reading information about the Host this node is allocated on.

      • getNffg

        NffgReader getNffg()
        Gives access to the NFFG this node is associated on.
        Returns:
        an interface for reading information about the NF-FG this node is associated on.
